TopicTitle: Is the only way to rescue with external seats? Or is there something more realistic?

Articles.Content: Can you launch a command pod without having it full up? Can you put Kerbals into another container somehow?

use kerbal manifest.

or put more than one command pod on your ship: the game fills only the first one with kerbals.

oh, and don't forget the hitchhiker module

Currently, there is no way known for me to do it other than take a kerbal out of the pod and ending its "flight", giving one seat left in the pod to rescue a kerbal with. Or you could just strap an empty pod on the rocket somwhere.
Cool, I didn't know it maxed out at 3. I don't use mods but it sounds like I have a solution
Choose something else as your starter thing not a pod, then put the pod on, it should be empty.
as classyjakey said, probe-piloted rescue craft are also a solution.

As of 0.20 (or was it 0.19?), using a probe first then a manned pod still results in the game populating the manned pod.

I either EVA the kerbals before launch, or use Kerbal Crew Manifest to unload them and then fly the rescue craft from a pod, since that way I can't mess up and strand even more kerbals somewhere.
The Hitchhiker pod sounds like it would cover this. As would EVAing a few kerbals from one of the capsules.

Deleted because it was no addition to the excellent advice already given.

Edited June 23, 2013 by Mr Shifty

Yes. And Yes.

For better answers, the container is called the hitchhiker module... and if you want multiple command pods on a ship (I would suggest adding power and a robot control pod), here is a video demonstrating it:
Yes, if you start with a probe, any added capsule will be empty, as far as I know. For large rescues, use the Hitchhiker Storage Container.
